Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Diagnostics \Di`ag*nos"tics\, n. That part of medicine which has to do with ascertaining the nature of diseases by means of their symptoms or signs. [1913 Webster]
His rare skill in diagnostics. --Macaulay. [1913 Webster]
diagnostics n : the branch of medical science dealing with the classification of disease [syn: {nosology}]
